“I'll see if I can finish early. We should have the evening together if I can.” Kory's hand slid down your arm, holding it tight. “And I'll take care of dinner tonight. I'd rather not leave you near an open flame, if you're going to spend the entire time daydreaming about me.” He leaned down to you, his mouth gently pressed to your forehead. You couldn't make a sound as you felt it. You only managed to nod your head, brushing into his neck as you did. You left a kiss right above the rim of his shirt before the two of you pulled apart, his tail sliding off from your leg as he turned away. You were still grinning as you gave him a small wave goodbye as you watched him turn to walk out.

An awkward silence filled the air as the door closed, and you sighed before turning around. The others in the room suddenly resumed their exercises, the clang of metal sounding out again by the time you looked around the room. You only glanced over everybody, but you couldn't be sure if they were uncomfortable, upset, or even jealous of Kory. However, nobody seemed surprised to see the massive red panda that had just left. Something was definitely weird, and after what had just happened, you weren't in any state to continue your workout. You quickly picked up your things before walking out, your mind wandering somewhere else.

You stared at the watch as you walked through the campus, too distracted to care where you were going. Your thoughts turned more and more towards it, trying to remember exactly when everything had happened. Things were normal before Kory had left for the weekend. He surprised you when he came back, but you were the only one who seemed to notice. Then, a few minutes ago, he had managed it again, somehow sneaking up on you while he was another foot or so taller and a good deal stronger.

There wasn't any other explanation for it. The only thing that might've done it was the watch that you had on. You could see one the hands on it ticking along smoothly, but you weren't sure what it was keeping track of. Glancing around for the nearest clock, you fumble and quickly lift your watch up, trying to compare it to the large clock installed on the side of a nearby building. It took a couple of minutes to be certain, but the clock's hands weren't moving at the same rate. You could only guess what it was doing as you took it off, flipping it around and trying to get a good look at the back of it. It seemed ordinary enough to you, but after a few moments of examining the watch before you remembered something.

Kory had done something with the watch to get it started again.

Without any tools or anything besides his hands, Kory had done something to get the watch started again. That meant that there had to be some way of adjusting the watch, if you could figure out how. There were a few knobs along the edges, but they had never responded before. On closer inspection, you could see a few scratches along the back. It might be possible to pry the watch open, though you weren't sure exactly how it might work. You would have to ask Kory when you got a chance...

Your thoughts snap back to Kory as you grip the watch by the strap. If the watch had done something, then it would explain how Kory had inexplicably grown over the last few days, and the last few hours. You always had a funny feeling in your arm whenever the watch brushed up against him. It happened back when you first kissed, and when you held him this morning... It even happened a little while ago. So, if you were right, then the next time you saw Kory...

You aren't sure whether you were more distracted by the memories of your embrace, or by the idea of Kory changing more. You had always found him attractive, but the idea of him as a massive, powerful hunk was even more difficult for you to ignore. You could imagine him easily throwing an arm around you, pulling you into his chest as he looks at you with the warm smile he always gave you. You could reach up and pull yourself up against his neck, nuzzling up against his body and press your mouth to his, feeling his sheath press up to yours as the two of you kiss.

You were snapped out of your reverie by the sudden stampede of furs coming through the area. A quick glance back up at the clock told you that it was almost time for you to head to Literature. You stood up rather quickly, wanting to avoid the glances that numerous people were giving you as they walked by. You never found time to change from your workout clothes, and you had to assume that the rumors of you and Kory were only spreading more. Hoping that nobody had noticed the slight shape forming in your pants, you started dashing towards your class, uncertain of what you were going to do. Literature usually wasn't too busy, and you normally spent the time speaking with Kory. If he was gone, then you might get some time to examine the watch in closer detail. However, if Kory had changed again, then you didn't want to be surprised the next time you saw him. The idea of running in, only to have him looming over, easily dragging you in after him...

Okay. Being surprised wouldn't be too bad. But you couldn't keep on acting confused every time you saw him. If you could get a better idea of exactly how much he's changed, it might be useful in helping you act normal the next time you saw him. You didn't use it too often, but you might be able to check through your phone for a photos or a text conversation that could help clear things up a bit.
111112.title: Thoughts

choices: Alan looks a little bigger than you remember.
Alan asks if he seems bigger. He's always been big for a rabbit, right?
You feel a little weird when you wake up.
Something wakes you up while it's still dark.
You oversleep after some odd dreams, and Alan's there when you wake.
12.content:
You're momentarily distracted from the TV as you feel something against your side. You turn your head down a bit as you feel a rabbit's tail lightly wiggling against your thigh. He sits right next to you, supposedly to watch TV with you. But at a glance, you can see that his eyes are busy looking right at your chest and neck. You only let off a quiet chuckle as you roll your head slowly, letting your neck tense and shift around. The rabbit's leg shifts against yours as he watched, and you could feel him sliding away slightly when his gaze met yours.

"W-what is it? I was... I wasn't looking at you..."

"Riiiight. Let me know when you figure out what's so interesting about the wall, then." You can't help but smile as you felt Alan turning away, his blush clear as he crossed his arms huffed a bit. You smile and just pull him in, giving his head a quick ruffle.

It had been a coincidence that the you and Alan had met. You had decided to rent out the spare room in order to earn a bit of extra cash, and he had been the only one that you were comfortable with accepting. Most of the smaller guys that you had met were a bit frightened the moment they saw you, and had passed up the place after taking a quick look around. On the other hand, you didn't trust any of the jocks to leave the house intact when they get a little reckless. The party you held last year taught you that the hard way.

When you first met Alan, You had expected him to run off like most of the others. He had the same cute, nervous expression on his face when he saw you walking out to greet him. His ears drooped a tiny bit, and he always seemed a little scrawny to you. However, while he seemed nervous about the idea of living with you, he had liked the look of the place. You were quite surprised when he agreed to take the place.

It did take him a few days before he was willing to do anything beside head straight to his room and close the door. He only poked his head out for the first time while you were cooking dinner. He had meekly asked for some after seeing the rather sizable amount you had made for yourself. That night was the first time the two of you actually spent a bit of time talking to one another, but after he got used to speaking with you, the two of you seemed to get along great.

From then on, Alan started getting more comfortable around the house. He was always a little jumpy if you suddenly came in or if you managed to sneak up on him. It was always amusing to see how much he jumped whenever you suddenly grabbed his shoulder from behind. However, it quickly become a natural occurrence to the two of you, and it felt like most of the time, he ended up brushing his tail against you whenever he jumped. You couldn't help but think that he was doing it intentionally.

You certainly didn't mind that. You enjoyed getting a bit of attention, and more than a few people would want to get their hands on your body. It was part of the reason you were always training hard, and you were usually more than happy to let someone get a good feel of your arms. You were quite a bit taller than most others, at six feet and a few inches on top. And with the lifting that you've been doing ever since middle school, you dwarfed most of the people you've met. Combined with your light gray fur and your fierce grin, you certainly had the look of a predator. But because of that, most of the people were a bit intimidated by you. Whenever you were in a bad mood, people tended to give you a wide breadth. Alan was the only one who had asked when you were upset, and he was the only one who had ever risked trying to cheer you up when you seemed like you might bite someone's head off. He had been quite worried when he tried to give you a hug, but ever since then, the two of you had grown more and more relaxed and comfortable with each other.

But with the amount of time you two spent together, you started suspecting Alan of having a bit of a crush on you. It was difficult to miss the stares that he would give you when you had arrived back from a workout, or when you were busy cooking. Even when the two of you were sitting together, you could notice his eyes glancing around your body and his hands restlessly fidgeting as his hand rest in your lap.

Although you had never said anything to him, you had grown fond of the idea of pulling him in tight and kissing him. Even though he was so shy, he always had a warmth that made him easy for you to speak to. The only thing keeping you from asking him out were the small signals he wanted to be the one to ask. With some of the quiet conversations he's made, it always felt like he was close to finding the courage to ask you out, and you didn't want to ruin that chance for him. It would feel too much like "jumping him", as it were.

"H-hey, Gren? I-i've got something to ask..."

"Hm?" You smile casually as you turn your head down. The TV was turned off at some point, and all of Alan's attention seems to be turned towards you. From the sound of it, Alan's going to try again. You happily reach a hand forward, before pulling him a little closer by the shoulder. Alan's eyes looking right at yours. He had a deep blush on his face this time, and you only let your hand move to his side, gently holding him in place. "What is it?"

"I... I was wondering..." Alan struggles to keep his eyes looking at yours, but he manages to keep speaking as his gaze falters. "I-if you want... I mean, if you're interested... Would... Would you want to... You know... Go out with me sometime?"

You break into a wide grin before leaning in, your lips pushing in against his. You hear a sudden gasp coming from him, your hands barely keeping him from jumping back as he felt it. The kiss only lasted for a second, but Alan was redder than you ever remember seeing him as you pulled away. "There... That wasn't so hard, was it?"

"Y-you knew I was going to ask? I... I thought I was..." Alan's eyes are staring towards the ground as he speaks. You reach a hand forward, only giving a firm nod as you pulled him in closer, your arms now firm to his back.

"I was wondering when you would. Took you a while." You lightly nuzzle in against one of his ears, chuckling as you just pull him close, your arms firm to his body. "I'd love to go out with you sometime, Alan."

"G-great!" He just grins wide, nearly jumping into your lap as he tries to get his arms around you. You chuckle and just lift him in your arms, shifting onto your feet and holding him gently.

"Hang on... I got something for you. I've been saving it for when you were feeling brave enough to ask." You reach into your pocket, taking out a small box. You open it up for him, revealing a simple wooden charm on a string. You had found the charm somewhere in the woods, and had decided to attach the string yourself. The slight pattern and shape of it had reminded you of a curled-up rabbit, and it reminded you of Alan when you had seen it.

He blushes a little bit as he took a good look at it. "R-really?"

"Just something I thought would fit you." You grin as you just press the box into his hands, kissing his cheek as he stared. "Something to remind you that you don't have to be nervous around me." You lightly pull the charm out, lifting it over his ears. He tries to keep exactly still for you as you place it onto his neck. You can almost swear you were feeling a warm tingling as you lowered it, it lightly tapping against his shirt as he reaches up and grasps it.

He only manages to make a small sound, before looking up at you. "T-thanks... So, I'll meet you here after class tomorrow?"

"Sounds good." You yawn and stretch out a little as you stand up with him still in your arms. "We'd better get a good night's sleep, then... Want to be awake for tomorrow." You smile as you see him nod eagerly.

"R-right... Tomorrow..." The two of you stand there, holding each other for another minute or so before breaking apart. You went straight to your room after, hoping to give him some time to process everything. Hopefully, tomorrow, the two of you could go out without him being worried about others seeing.

But it would be early tomorrow when something odd happens.
12.title: Leadup to a First Date

He's a little jumpy when he comes out, and says that he thinks he's growing.
He heads out to clear his head, and you don't see him until later.
122.content:
“Hey... Blake? You up?”

“Muh?” You make a small sound, the sheets sliding against your body as you shift. You groggily look at the alarm clock, shaking your head a little bit. The red numbers displayed the time clearly. With a grunt, you turn back to the door way. You can see Alan's shape in front, and you rubbed your eyes a bit to try to clear them out. “Alan, it's six in the morning. What's wrong?”

“S-sorry...” He slouches a little bit, his ears brushing against the door frame as he does. “I just... felt a little weird today...”

“You aren't sick or anything, are you?” You yawn and stretch out before slowly trying to sit up, your sheets falling from your chest and piling near your waist.

“N-no, nothing like that... Just a little odd.” He had put on the same tight shirt and jeans that he usually wore, and he shifts side to side as you look at him. “I mean, it feels like the roof got a little lower or something.”

“Thought you said that the place was comfortable enough for you.” You yawn and slowly slide off the bed, stretching out a little bit. You could see Alan turn away nervously. Letting out a quiet chuckle, you reach over to your shelf, throwing on a pair of sweats over your boxers before speaking again. “What, having second thoughts about your living arrangements or something?”

Alan's head shakes wildly in response, and you only smile as you walk up to him, placing a firm hand on his shoulder. “Of course not!”

You smile and lean in, nuzzling his cheek for a moment before giving him a squeeze. “Mmmm. That's good to hear. I doubt I'd find a better roommate.” His blush grows deeper as you hold him, and you keep him there for a moment before slowly releasing. You press your forehead to his, only leaning in a little to do so. "Hm... Your temperature feels okay... Don't think you're sick..."

He blinks a few times as he feels you leaning in against him. He looks up at you for a moment, before he suddenly realizes what's happening. He was incredibly red, and you could swear he would jump out the window just to avoid being seen like this. You just grinned and took a hold on his hand. “Come on. If we're both up, I might as well make some breakfast for us. You should take it easy until you can get your bearings again, okay?”

He gives a small nod in response, following you out of the room. You chuckle quietly as you moved to the kitchen, lightly pulling him along with you. Alan sits down at the table and staring at you while you work. You let your tail brush gently over your legs as you cook, grabbing a few things from the cabinets and turning on the stove.

“You're making a bit much, aren't you?” Alan asks with a rather quiet voice, bending a little to look over the food you're cooking.

“Not any more than usual... Is your appetite not very good today or something?” You turn your head, a little curious as Alan sits. However, his gaze quickly turns down to his hands, and he seems to murmur something to himself before responding.

“No, no, it's fine...” Alan continues staring into his hands as you worked, clearly still lost in thought. "I guess I'm just a little out of it..." He only looked back up when you placed his plate in front of him.

You press your hand onto the top of his head, ruffling his fur a little bit. "Just didn't sleep well, maybe?" You place your own plate nearby, sitting next to him. He shakes his head before picking up a fork and getting to work on his meal. "If you say so. Just take it easy, okay, little guy?" You start to wolf down your own meal, only just noticing Alan's blush as he ate rather absentmindedly. You can't help but smile when you notice him looking around, glancing at you between his bites.

When you finish, you lean back in your chair, tilting it back a bit as you look at Alan. His plate is empty, but he's still staring at it as he thinks. You reach over the table, grabbing his hand suddenly. He looks up, a little startled as you hold him. "Come on, Alan. What's on your mind? You've been out of it all morning. "

"It's..." He paused for a moment, his eyes level with yours for a moment. He suddenly stands up, pulling you a little with him. "Hey, Blake? How tall are you, again?"

"Hm? Six foot three, I think. Didn't you ask me that before?"

"Right, right... Just making sure... I think I forgot. Felt like there was more of a difference between us." Alan moved a little, shifting on his feet, rising up and down a few inches as he moved.

"Hey, a two inch difference isn't that much." Alan seemed to flinch as you spoke, his ears sagging a little bit. "What, disappointed or something? Come on, you're already one of the bigger bunnies that I know." You smile and nuzzle in against his cheek, though he shakes his head a little bit. But before you pull away, he finally perks up a bit.

"R-right. Thanks, Blake. Think I just... you know. Need to clear my head and everything. Um... You remember how much I weighed? Last time I checked, I mean."

It was a random question, but you shrug it off as you pick up the plates, moving them to the sink. "Um... 180 or so from last week. Why? Need to check again or something? Maybe you should check again, if you're feeling out of it. Make sure you didn't lose anything weight you're sick or something."

"Y-yeah... Definitely need to." He quickly dashed out of the room, leaving you shaking your head a little as you tried to understand exactly what was going on.
122.title: Off in the Morning

Nervous, you back away.
Just then, the little necklace he's wearing flares with a subtle, blue light.
1223.content:
Whatever was wrong with Alan, it was definitely rattling him. He'd left the kitchen in a hurry after which you heard him running the water in the bathroom down the hall. After a few more minutes, though, you heard the door slam and caught a glipse of him heading down the road at a jog. On the table were his wallet and keys: forgotten.

A twinge of concern washes over you and, for a moment, you consider going after him. You stop, though, realizing that it's probably nerves over the impending date you and he have scheduled. It occurs to you that Alan may not have ever dated another guy, before. It could be that you are his first.

The thought makes you smile but also gives you a twinge of concern. Young guys could be awfully nervy their first time.

Maybe you should phone; just to reassure him. He always had his mobile on him: all you need is the number.

You go through his wallet but find no number, just his driver's license.

"Alan Whittaker," you huff under your breath, "don't go all Single White Female on me, now."

You don't find his phone number but, after looking around, you find his phone by the couch in the living room. Deciding that whatever happens, happens, you go about your day and wait for him to come home.

Classes are fairly ordinary, a bit more homework from your calculus professor than you would have liked, but still tolerable. You didn't see Alan anywhere on campus all day. Your stoic decision to not get worried has started to seem increasily irrational by the time you arrive back at your countryside home. You look to the mountains in the distance and sigh.

Should you call the police?

The sun continues to set in the west as you wrestle with your conscience.

"Gren?"

Alan's voice takes you by surprise and you jump. Spinning around, you see him just beyond the door in the shadows of the first floor landing. Cast in darkness, you can only just make out his general, long-eared outline. Even if you couldn't tell by the tremor in his voice, his use of your last name, "Gren", was a sure sign he was nervous. You'd only gotten him to start calling you "Blake" about two weeks ago.

"Alan, what's wrong?"

The nervous rabbit falters, not answering you right away. "I ... I think something's wrong with me," he says. "I mean ... really wrong."

Your heart skips a bit as you step forward. "Geez, Alan; what? What is it?"

Slowly, he steps into the light of the living room lamp.

You blink and can't help but stare.

Alan stands up to his full height, a full foot and a half taller than you. His muscles have grown and he looks like his clothing were just painted on, it's so tight. His big feet slap against the carpet as he ambles forward. Easily seven-foot-nine, the towering rabbit doesn't get terribly close but, rather, just hangs his head and shyly says, "I...I'm growing."
1223.title: A Case of Nerves

Watching it happen, made something click. Blake sees the change.
12233.content:
You quirk a brow and sigh with relief that it wasn't anything serious. “But, Alan, you told me you’ve already seen tens of doctors about your size. Apart from congratulating you and looking slightly bewildered when they thought you weren't looking, all checked out fine, right?”

Alan took a step forward, having to bend awkwardly under the suddenly too low frame and took on an utterly surprised look. “You’re serious, aren't you?” He hummed lowly. “You really don’t see me as any different? Nothing…” He stretched his figure upright, his long ears splaying out to the sides as his head met the ceiling “.. Out of the ordinary here?”

You force a smile and suppress a chuckle “That was kind of my first hint of your attraction towards me. That you said this place was comfortable for you..”

Walking to the bookshelves guarding one corner of the living room with mostly Alan’s fantasy and sci-fi fiction, you lean down to dig through the bottom row of your own more gloomy horror novels, shockingly heavy on werewolf titles, and pull out a stack of papers hidden between “Cry Wolf” and “Moon Called”

You show the half crumbled papers to be house listings, big red circles around each with high ceilings or permissions to build them, and Alan lets out a soft gasp and whimper as suddenly his necklace started to shine with a faint icy-blue aura. Both of you stare at the illuminated jewelry and Alan sighs “Not again!”

For a few long seconds nothing seemed to happen other than Alan looking down on you, his handsome face briefly distorting with anxiety before turning to one of pleasure. He puffs out his white fluffy chest, making his fur-tight shirt pull even tighter and snap a few strands across his shoulders. His muzzle opens slightly, and with a hushed moan Alan began to grow.

His head pressed further against the unmoving ceiling, making his legs bend and his thighs take more and more of Alan’s increasing weight. His jeans, already bought to be tight on him two feet ago was unsurprisingly ready to burst, and with the sound of stretching cloth and flesh it did.

Alan’s jeans burst on both sides showing his milky and randomly black dotted fur barely covering the strained definition of his muscles underneath, as his growing body unclothed itself for you. Within less than 10 seconds Alan had gone from an already impressive seven-foot-nine to nearly nine, and his necklace was still glowing merrily. His shirt had begun to rise up over his lean stomach, showing more muscle definition than you’d expect from a rabbit, and the tears over his shoulders ripped across his chest and down his sides, pulling the strands of the fabric so thin and so far apart the cloth was noticeably less opaque; almost like a winning wet-shirt contestant.

Most noticeable change, at least to Alan, was at his crotch. The jeans did a valiant job at keeping him contained, the seams stronger here than anywhere else, but there was so much more rabbit to contain as well. And it was clear to both of you that whatever Alan was going through, he enjoyed it muchly.

Alan blushed furiously at this point, not planning his long anticipated date to start and end quite this quickly. He moved his heavy body and sat down in front of, and half filling, the doorway he entered through earlier. His larger-than-life paws extended out towards you and with one final surge of size pushing his head up to ten-feet-eleven, and finally ripping his tortured trousers to tatters around his legs, making them look like very revealing hotpants.

“Please tell me.. you saw.. THAT” Alan panted heavily, resting his paws in his lap to hide the obvious bulges. “Because I really don’t think I can go through this alone..”
12233.title: A date and a show.

choices: The two of you talk about how the entire thing started.
You try to reacquaint Alan with the current reality.
122331.content:
"Alan... So you... Grew? Just now?" You stare up at him, trying to keep your eyes up to meet his. His head gives a feeble nod, the desperation clear on his face.

"Y-yeah..." He's still panting for breath, one of his paws still covering his lap while the other rises to try to hold his chest. His hand pauses as it pushes against the bottom of his pec, his head suddenly twitching downward when it makes contact with the tense-looking muscle... "It must've been a few feet... You saw it, right? Please tell me you noticed..." His eyes jump towards you, but a sinking feeling fills your chest as you try to meet them. You shake your head briefly, turning your head down towards the ground. Alan's barely holding back tears as he looks down at you, "Gren... Please... I can't..." His breathing is labored, and he's trying to cover up with just his hands, barely able to conceal any part of his impressive, toned body. "This is crazy... If this keeps up, I'm going to..."

"Alan... Alan, it's okay." You quietly move up against him, placing your hand firmly against his wrist, squeezing as much as you're able to. As usual, he doesn't budge an inch, but his ears still shift a little, turning to your direction. "I promise, you''ll be okay."

"Gren, I don't know what's going on! Nobody's this big! But suddenly, I've grown to this size...And you can't... You must think I'm insane! What am I supposed to do? How am I supposed to deal with the fact that I'm-"

"Alan. Alan!” You try to shout, but you're not sure if he can even hear you over his near-breakdown. “Alan, take a breath, okay? It's okay! I believe you!" You reach forward, clenching his hand firmly like you always have before. But even when you grab him, he's still talking over you, too caught up in his rant to notice.

“I mean, you must think I'm crazy! Hell, if you told me you were shrinking, I wouldn't believe it, either! But I can't stand this! If I you don't even believe that I'm growing, how am I supposed to-"

You grimace for a moment, before bracing yourself against his arm. You suddenly jump, pulling down his arm as you do. His arm flexes automatically when you grab him, and you manage to sling yourself up enough to press your arm against his shoulders. The moment you can reach it, you firmly pull his head down to meet yours. He's hunched over a little awkwardly as you pull his forehead to yours, your eyes locked to his. "Alan! I said I believe you, okay? I believe you're growing."

"You... What? You do?” You still spot traces of tears on his eyes, but he's now staring right at you.

“Alan..." He's still breathing hard, but you give a small nod to him, confirming your words for him. "Look, Alan... I don't know what's going on either. I mean, to me, you've always been 10' 11”.” Alan flinches at the number, the record-breaking height a shock to him. You try to give him a comforting pat against his shoulder. “But I can tell you're worried. So, I promise, I'll do whatever I can to help you through it, okay? I don't need to see you growing to know that whatever's happening is a shock to you, and if there's anything I can do to help, I want to do it.”

“Gre- Blake...” You're suddenly pulled off your feet, the familiar lightness filling your body as Alan literally sweeps you off your feet to pull you in tight against his chest. “Thanks...”

You smile and softly squeeze against his shoulder as you lean in. "Of course, Alan." Your nose bumps softly against his cheek, the shade of red showing up clear on his face.

It takes a few minutes before Alan's calmed down enough to let you go. He shuffles a little awkwardly as he looks to you, lowering you to the floor as he looks at you. "Um... Blake..." He awkwardly fumbles with his hand again, still trying to cover up. "Can you... You know... Turn away for me? It's... Kind of embarrassing... I'd prefer if..."

"Right, right..." You can't help but break into a small smile as you turn away. You hear a few heavy footsteps from behind you, the rabbit fumbling around for something as you wait. After a few couple of minutes of unsuccessfully searching, you have to shout, "If you need it, there's a large blanket for you on the couch. You can cover up with that."

"Where?" The surprise in his voice is obvious, but after a few moments, it sounds like he's found it. There's a slight thump as he sits onto the floor, and you turn in time to catch him sitting on the floor, the blanket strewn across his lap. "Thanks, Blake... I... I know it's kind of our first date and all, but I didn't really think we'd... you know... You'd see my unmentionables tonight..."

You try to turn away again, not quite sure how to break it to him. "Um... Alan... I've... Kind of... Already seen..."

"What!?" The entire building shakes from the sheer volume of his shout, and you're almost certain that the neighbors heard him this time.

"Yeah... Um... You... don't know, right? Well, you've always... No, you haven't... This you... You in this universe?" Your head's a little fuzzy as you try to figure out how to best explain it. "Whatever it is... Well, before, you said you had a hard time getting clothing that fits you... And... We kind of set up the blanket for you after the first time your pants..."

"O-oh..." Alan's ears slouch, and from what you can hear, it sounds like he's trying to pull the blanket over his head. You can't help but break into a small smile as you approach him again. You reach under the blanket, fumbling around before grasping his paw.

"Hey... Take it easy. This must be crazy for you, too... But we'll figure this out."

The two of you sit in silence for a few minutes. But eventually, you feel him move. The blanket slips enough for his head to peek out from the edge of it. The rabbit's still worried, but despite it all, you spot the small smile on his face.

"O-okay."

122332.content:
Blake stared at the rabbit as he grew, his ears twitching to catch every sound of shredding clothes or fur whispering along the floor. His eyes seemed to grow wider and wider as Alan's height increased, until they were as big as saucers when the incredible spurt ended. When the now-giant rabbit spoke, his voice was much deeper and louder. Those huge paws, as thick as they were, couldn't quite cover the bulge between his legs.

The wolf could only stare in silence for a couple of moments while his brain caught up with the reality of the situation. In the meantime, Alan sat there mostly naked, his ears flattened against the ceiling.

"I don't...I don't believe it." The wolf could hear a ringing in his ears, and it was hard to catch his breath. He was stricken with the feeling that a part of the world had opened up to him that he should never have seen. Either his entire understanding of the universe was flawed, or...there was something seriously wrong with Alan.

"Blake? Blake..." The rabbit boomed at him, leaning closer to peer. "Maybe you should sit down."

Blake nodded dumbly and sat there, right on the floor. For a moment he couldn't really understand what he was seeing. That couldn't have been Alan's leg. It was far too big, sprawled across the floor like a huge, mottled-fur couch. The rabbit shouldn't...shouldn't be filling up his room. No one should be that size.

He felt paws around him, gently pushing him down on the floor. His vision blurred as he stared at the ceiling, and he thought Yes, a nap would be good before he lost consciousness.

* * * * *


Blake woke up on the couch, quite suddenly. He gasped, then held his head against the dull throbbing in it, then wondered if the surreal scene that played out before him was a dream. He looked around. He was in their apartment, but Alan was nowhere to be found. Maybe it was a dream. He breathed a sigh of relief, even though it raised all sorts of other questions about what would cause such weird sensations in him.

"Oh, good, you're awake." A voice rumbled near him, familiar but much deeper and louder.

The wolf startled and stared at the corner. Sure enough, Alan was there in his near eleven-foot glory. The rabbit gave him a sheepish grin and a wave.

"I thought that was a dream," the wolf moaned, slumping back onto the couch. So it was true. Alan had grown, inexplicably, and that had all kinds of terrible, wonderful implications. Magic was real. There was more to the world than he had ever dared hoped for. He should have felt like a kid who had just seen Santa at Christmas, but there was a mild dread in the pit of his stomach instead.

"I wish it were," Alan said, shifting his massive weight closer to the couch. He bumped it slightly, sending the furniture scooting a couple of inches along the floor. "Sorry," he muttered with folded ears.

"Don't worry about it." Blake shrugged. He hadn't broken anything yet, but at his size in this room it was only a matter of time. "How...how long have you been having these sorts of episodes or whatever?"

Alan perked his ears, the tall appendages slapping against the ceiling before he remembered to sit down on his haunches. "Just a few days ago. When we...you know..."

"Got together?" Blake couldn't help but grin as the giant rabbit nodded and blushed. Even despite the fact that he was twice the size he should have been, he was still the same old Alan. "But...how big were you before all this started?"

"You mean you don't remember anything?" Alan looked surprised.

The wolf shook his head. "No, I just...I just remember the last one. Before then you were about eight feet tall, right?" Again, Alan nodded. "That's the size you should be, in my mind."

"I was a few inches over five feet a few days ago."

"You're kidding."

Alan shook his head and bit his lower lip with those huge buck teeth. Blake felt a stirring in his pants that he was surprised by. It's nice to know that he's warming to the idea of such an oversized partner.

"I...it's been happening a lot. And every time this thing glows." The rabbit lifted a blue crystal that dangled from a silver chain. Up until now, it had been mostly hidden in his thick fur. It was an easy thing to miss -- unless it glowed.

Blake perked his ears and leaned forward to stare at it. It was comically undersized against Alan's large fingers, but he could see it all right. It looked just like a quartz crystal, only it was the color of turquoise, deep and rich. The wolf wouldn't have guessed it as anything special, but plainly it was what was causing the rabbit's excessive spurts. "That's...weird. Where did you get it from?"

Alan quirked his ears in thought for a moment. Then he said:

”you know, I can’t remember!..” Alan scratched a finger across the ornate crystal, that had something carved into the side. It was odd; it seemed like something he should remember. Like something with great affectionate value to him. Like… A totem? That was the best description the rabbit could come up with before Blake interrupted him.

“But if this necklace made you… uh, grow” Blake grimaced as he said those words, and forced himself to stare at everything besides the big rabbit filling the room. “Why haven’t you taken it off?”

“That’s a joke, right?” Alan glared down at his wolven companion who continued to stare at the wall beside him or at the tall ears stretching along the ceiling “As if that thought never occurred to me too.” He pulled the string up and nearly forced his head through the ceiling as the strap caught on his chin. “It does grow with me, it seems, but it took the liberty of shrinking just small enough to be stuck first.” He spoke as if the necklace had an intention with being around his neck and enlarging him, but as far as either of them knew, it may have.

Blake raised a finger and opened his mouth before getting cut off “.. and no, the string doesn’t cut with any scissors or knives we own either.” Alan shuffled carefully on the floor making the floor creak in protest as he lifted his weight up on his arms and stretched one long leg out along the floor and his glare softened “I’m so sorry, Gren.. I never meant to be.. Whatever it is I’ve become”

Now, for the first time since he came to Blake could look Alan eye to eye and gave him a stern look “What you’ve become, Alan dear, is a bigger version of ‘you’; and ‘you’ are the only person ever to see through what everyone else sees in me and dig your way through to my heart. I saw it in your eyes then, and I see it now. You’re the best thing to happen to me, and who can argue that more of a good thing is worse?”

Blake was unsure of whether he had sounded like the cheesy, babbling, dullard that he felt saying it, or the comforting and caring wolf he wanted to show Alan he could be. All he could do was to look for any signs in the large rabbit’s eyes as to whether he was successful or not. He at least felt the need to emphasize his point by reaching out and placing a paw onto Alan’s stretched legs, and felt the muscles under his paw contract and shiver.

Alan had been able to find a blanket to wrap around his body before the wolf had woken up, but now as his legs had moved so had the mass that seemed to round the blanket at the rabbit’s crotch. And with the contact, the spheres seemed to jump and round the fabric further.

Alan blushed furiously and attempted to cover himself up with his paws. Blake withdrew his paw and stared openly. While Alan had doubled his overall size, the bulges that now seemed to push his legs apart slightly - much to the bunny’s discomfort - had clearly done more growing than that!

Alan whimpered and ran a paw across the blanket which concealed less of him than it did a minute ago, and sighed. “I guess there’s no reason to pretend you didn’t see that.” He said, and moved his paws to the side letting the smaller wolf get a good look at the distending crotch.

Both sat there motionlessly, while the blanket heaved to Alan’s heartbeat and an alluring musk began to draft through the room. The large rabbit moved carefully forward, getting on his knees and paws and leaned in over Blake before, in one fluid motion, planting his large lips across the wolf’s entire muzzle.

Just then…

12233222.content:
Antonio Jaliero was on the track team and was one of the only sports-minded guys at Avondale College Blake could stomach. He was taller than Blake and leaner, too. But most cheetahs were. His spots, however, were curious in that they seemed to spiral outwards from his head in wider and wider circles as they approached his waist. Below that, they grew smaller and tighter, again, until his feet became lost in their umber tone. Seven feet tall, he was always the guy who loomed over everyone else when the local jocks in the sports fraternity, Kalama-U, dragged him along for pizza.

Why he was standing at his door, Blake didn’t know. Glancing out the window, he could just see the big basketball player standing by the second-floor walk-up to his condo apartment.

“Who is it?” Alan asked.

For a man over ten feet tall, he sounded awfully timid. Part of that was probably due to him being mostly naked, now. The only parts of his clothing that were left after his growth spurts were tiny rings of fabric around his ankles and a shredded “collar” of his shirt that stretched across his broad shoulders.

“Anton,” Blake said. “Antonio; from the gym.”

“The cheetah?” Alan’s eyes widened a bit and he chewed his lower lip. “What’s he doing here?”

“I’ll go find out.”

Antonio knocked again while Alan and Blake argued. Alan didn’t want to risk discovery and thought they should just wait until the jock went away. Blake, on the other hand, thought it would look suspicious because their neighbors in the condo clearly knew that he was home and, if Antonio started asking around, he’d find out. Plus, his car was in the side lot next to their tiny, picturesque home.

“Besides,” Blake said, “Anton is pre-med … sports medicine, I think. Worse comes to worst, maybe he’ll know what’s happening to you.”

“You think they teach magic curses in sports med?” Alan asked with uncharacteristic sarcasm.

Blake just smiled and left the living room. Antonio was knocking again as he crossed into the kitchen and opened the door.

“There you are,” the cheetah said. He looked down at Blake with his bright, yellow eyes. His tail, poked through the tiny hole in the back of his jogging shorts, swished impatiently. “You forget?”

Blake blinked. “Forget? Forget what?” The humor of his statement didn’t strike him but made Antonio smile.

“Very funny,” he said. “The party … the fund-raiser at the frat house.” When Blake looked blankly in return, the cheetah frowned. “To raise money for the new bio-hike trails out at Ashcone Park?”

Ashcone Park was the national nature preserve about an hour’s drive from town. Blake went there, often, to go hiking along the old, weathered slopes of the extinct volcano. The rich, deep forests around its base had originally been cut by logging companies before a native tribal group managed to get them to stop cutting down their ancestral home. With equal money from the state, they’d turned the ground into a national park and nature preserve. They could still use it for cultural observances but, most of it ...most of the time... was open to the public. Blake loved the place.

But he had no memory of some sort of trail fundraiser.

“What are you talking about?” he asked.

Now, Antonio was looking concerned. “You okay, man?” He put his furred palm against Blake’s forehead. The wolf tolerated it but scowled. “You running a fever?”

“I’m not sick,” he replied. “I just haven’t heard of this, before.”

Antonio cocked one brow. From the other room, he could hear Alan rustling around. He was probably trying to move around a bit on his hands and knees since he couldn’t stand up any more. The ceilings may have been high but even ten feet was shorter than Alan, now. He wouldn’t have believed it if he hadn’t seen it; he still had trouble believing it.

“Blake: you’re the one who told us about it.”

Blake blinked. “What?”

“You told us about it. When you ran into us a couple weeks ago out on the trails. You were hiking; me and the rest of the basketball team were doing our jogging on the trails. You said you’d met a park ranger or something who said they were raising funds to fix some old trails and build a few new ones. We hatched the plan, there, to put on a fundraising party at the house.”

Now Blake knew that Antonio was pulling his leg. But why would he make up a story like this? He wasn’t like most of the muscle-headed morons who lived at Kalama-U. Maybe one of the others had put him up to it.

“Look, Anton,” he said, “I don’t know why you’re saying this, but—”

The sound of a crash—of something fragile breaking—echoed from the adjacent living room. Blake looked back, concerned, and Antonio jumped.

“What—?”

“It’s nothing,” Blake said, wondering if Alan was okay. There was no sound or cry from the room after the breaking noise so he guessed something had fallen over. “Look, we’re busy right now, and—”

“We? Alan, too? I thought he was late; you’re both here?”

Antonio pushed past Blake and walked towards the living room. Blake grabbed his shoulder but only caught a tuft of fur. The long-legged athlete was easily able to get past him in a few steps. He stopped, staring, at the sight through the door into the living room.

Blake joined him with a sigh.

Shattered lamp on the floor next to one of Alan’s oversized feet, the now-giant rabbit sat on his cotton-tailed rear with the blanket, again, over his lap. The insides of his ears were reddened in embarrassment. He raised a hand, shyly, and waved.

“Uh, hi.”

Blake grimaced and went back to close the outside door. “So, now that you know Alan’s ‘little problem’, maybe you can...”

“What the fuck happened?” Antonio exclaimed. “I mean, he’s … he’s huge!”

“Uh, yeah. I am. Good call, there,” Alan said with a bit more wryness than he probably intended. “I’ve been growing an inch or two in little spurts for the last few days. Then, this morning, those spurts started getting bigger.”

“But that’s … that’s...”

“Impossible?” Blake suggested.

“Magic,” Alan said.

The cheetah just shook his head, dully. After a moment, though, his eyes narrowed and he pointed up at Alan’s head. “Isn’t that the necklace-thingy you were going to give to him?” he asked.

Blake blinked. “Excuse me?”

“The charm around his neck,” Antonio said. “That was the little thing you said you found on the trails; the one you said you were going to give to Alan.”

“But I didn’t—”

Alan’s eyes grew wide. “That’s right! You did give it to me! To … to feel confidence! I wore it the night you and I first, uh...” he trailed off, embarrassed.

Antonio chuckled and shook his head. “Say no more.” He clapped Blake on the shoulder and smirked. “Always knew I didn’t have a chance; you like the small, shy ones, don’t you?”

“Now is not the time, Anton,” the wolf snarled.

None of this made sense. He didn’t remember the meeting on the Ashcone Park trails, finding that pendant-thingy, or giving it to Alan.

“And you don’t remember that?” Antonio asked.

“That’s not the only thing,” Alan said. “Earlier he didn’t even noticed I’d been growing. Only when this thing glowed and I started getting bigger, again, did he finally see it as out of the ordinary.”

Blake blinked. “But, this is impossible.”

“Magic,” Antonio said. “Look, clearly something’s messed with you guys’ heads. And I’d wager it has something to do with that glowy-thingy.”

Alan furrowed his brow for a moment as the words sank in. Then, eyes widening, he looked down.

Sure enough, the pendant was glowing again.

Alan lifted up to his oversized paws and crouch-walked towards the door. "I'll never be able to fit in here if I get any bigger. I have to get outside!"

The panic in his booming voice was enough to spur Blake to action. Antonio was already out of the door, opening it wider for the outsized rabbit to have the best chance he could of squeezing through. Alan grunted as he thumped the short distance towards the door, getting noticeably larger with each step. Blake watched in moderate fascination as he watched the rabbit's leg muscles ripple through his thick fur, growing larger and stronger to hold up what must have been his rapidly increasing weight.

He was nearly bent over double by the time he reached the door, and the proposition of him making it through without any damage was looking less and less likely. Still, Alan didn't waste any time trying. He immediately sank to one knee, the house shaking as he did, and thrust his head and shoulder through the door frame. The rabbit inhaled and his chest briefly swelled alarmingly thick, growing to fill the frame before he got it through.

He had to have been thirteen feet tall by now, and he was still growing. He landed with a room-shaking thud on his side and tried pulling himself the rest of the way. Every movement shook the inside of the house a little worse as his weight (and strength) increased by leaps and bounds. Worse still, that endowment was growing to obscene proportions. That sheathed cock was nearly as thick as one of Alan's forearms, and the tip reached down nearly to the rabbit's knee! It flopped like a fallen log as he wiggled out of the shrinking frame, then pushed against one side as the balls under it surged larger.

Blake thought he wouldn't make it; by the time his knees were through, the house shuddered alarmingly every time he replaced his weight. Those massive paws of his were the last challenge to get through, and they were growing even larger all the time. The big wolf could hear Alan grunt, his voice astonishingly deep and loud.

"You're almost there," he heard Antonio say. "Just be careful with your feet."

Alan's paws slammed against the wall, nearly taking it out. He stopped, and his paws grew to brush the opposite wall of the narrow hallway the door opened into. "Shit! Sorry."

"It's OK. Just, be careful."

The rabbit wiggled, then slid his paws through the door. His claws gouged a good chunk of the door on the way out, but considering he nearly ripped the door frame apart entirely it wasn't the worst that could have happened.

Blake got out of the house just in time to see Alan crawl out into the front yard and stand up to his full height. The glowing pendant winked out and his height leveled off at what must have been...sixteen feet tall, if the fact that Antonio only came up to the top of his thigh was any indication.

"Oh my God, oh my God. I'm outside and I'm NAKED." The rabbit's paws were wringing and his ears were flattened against his skull. He looked like he could die of embarrassment.

"Come on, let's go around the back. You can hide behind the fences there if you sprawl out. It'll be more comfortable too." Blake heard himself speaking, but he had no idea where the words were coming from. It was almost as if another person had thought them, and he was just tasked with the job of vocalizing them.

Alan thumped his way into the back and promptly sat down, leaving behind a trail of oversized pawprints pressed into the grass. Blake could scarcely believe this was happening. Wasn't there some kind of physical limit to how big someone could grow without tearing themselves apart? How much longer until Alan reached that? Or would the magic protect him from that?

He shut the back gate behind him. Alan was already sprawled out in the back yard, his enormous frame taking up a huge portion of it. He looked to be on the verge of tears.

"They're getting worse all the time," he wailed, his voice shaking the windows of the house. "How much bigger am I going to get?"

"I don't know, babe." Antonio rubbed the rabbit's head, trying to soothe him. "But we're going to figure this out before you get too much bigger, OK?"

"Right." Blake stepped up, suddenly remembering where he was. Here was this rabbit that he cared about, deeply, and he was hurting. "I'm so, so sorry that this happened to you, Alan. I never meant for any of this. If there's any way for me to reverse it, I will."

That finally seemed to calm him, and he turned to face the wolf. Good heavens, his torso was the size of a billboard. "I know you didn't mean for this to happen to me. The necklace was a really sweet gift. Thank you."

Blake felt his ears darkening. "You're welcome, Alan."

Antonio rolled his eyes as he appeared from behind the giant rabbit. "Now that the tender moment has happened, perhaps we could turn our attention to how we stop Alan from getting any bigger?"

Blake's blush deepened. Was the cheetah jealous or something? "Sure. Though I'm not sure what sort of leads we have."

The cheetah shrugged. "Maybe we could scout around the trail where you found it in the first place; there might be some clues there. Or we could check the lost and found...if I lost a magic amulet in the woods, you'd bet I'd want it back."

Alan lifted the huge necklace in one paw and squinted at it. "Or maybe we could take down these symbols and try to find out if they mean anything. They can't be here for no reason."

Antonio quirked an ear. "Maybe, but we wouldn't have a good idea of where to even start. I don't think any of us are well-versed in ancient or magical languages, are we?"

"Well, it's more to go on than stumbling around in the woods hoping to find something," Alan rumbled. It looked like he was getting a little testy. But who could blame him? In the past few hours he had practically tripled in height with no end in sight. He had gotten too big to be indoors, and there was no guarantee he'd ever be able to get small again.

Still, Antonio was opening his mouth to speak, his fangs flashing for a moment. He was a bit less understanding, and didn't take to snark too well. Blake had to speak up quickly to prevent him from saying something to escalate things.

Antonio grunted as he slithered his body close against the rock wall, fearing the drop ahead was he to step forward once. Not just because he felt sharp rocks tear at his fur like an out of control barber, but because today's expected party had been his one highpoint the entire week. The cheetah crept around the corner and sighed in frustration whilst willing his legs to stop wobbling. “So this is your idea of a plan? Drag me half way across the park and up a mountain, for a cave?”

“Volcano..”

Blake had wasted no time admiring the cave as he had the first time, and was already digging through piles of rock and stone searching for something.

“What Is this place, Blake?” Antonio steps forward and runs a paw across the walls, feeling the foul temper wash away and in its place, an oddly happy and warm mood fill him the closer he walks into the ‘crater’.

“I told you before” the wolf grunts as he rolls away another boulder stacked in the bottom corner. “it’s an ancient ritual site of some sort”.

“Okay.. So what are you looking for now?” he traces a finger into one of the glowing markings, and feels his fur stand on end and lets out a hushed moan.

“Aha! Found it! Here help me with this.” Blake stands back from the rocks he had thrown around and pulls with him a long thin rope, looking ancient yet oddly pristine. The wolf begins to pull on the string and from the rock floor a small square cut hatch seems to open. Antonio is quick to join in pulling on the rope, and when the heavy purposely cut piece of rock finally flop onto the floor he’s also the first to run over to the new opening. Walking on volcanoes might not be his favorite pastime, but treasure hunting certainly may be of them!

Along the side of the square hole are more of the same mysterious markings, seeming brighter and more energetic than the ones lining the walls above. Antonio’s eyes light up in bright amber with childish curiosity as he sees that on the bottom there are a small assortment of shrines and a few scrolls.

A dark grey paw reaches down into the primitive safe and pulls out a pawful of the neatly rolled papers. “This is what we came for! I’m sure the answer to whatever is happening to Alan is in one of these. And maybe a way to stop it..” The cheetah looked up as Blake unwrapped a random scroll and attempted to make sense of the text. Points for trying, but they both knew he had no chance at academic papers even now that he had finally found reason to.

As Blake bit down on his tongue in a display of ‘trying too hard’ while he ‘read’ his scrolls, the cheetah reaches down to pull out a shrine. A dull and wooden one rests amongst the shiny metal, yet the wood is riddled in glowing marks and begs for him to pick it up.

Curious as any cat, his eyes shine bright as he lifts the shrine noiselessly to his muzzle and gently opens the lid. Nothing but blackness seems to reside inside the box. Darker than he’d expect it to be on a bright and sunny day even if he was in a part cave.

Suddenly, and without a sound the lid snaps open and a dark haze erupts in Antonio’s face, making him sneeze and drop the box back into the hole.

“What was that?” Blake turns just as Antonio straightens himself back up to a seated position.

“Nothing! Nothing, just this stupid dusty air is making me sick is all” the cheetah crossed his arms and assumed his most menacing glare. Suddenly feeling a bit woozy and dizzy yet still oddly warm and comfortable.

“Right, I guess I’m not going to figure out what this says anyway.” Blake sighed and piled the scrolls up in his lap, pulled off his belt and tied it around the papers. “I can only hope Alan can make some sense of them. I need to get back to him anyway, I don’t like the way I left him behind…”

“Yea, Alan might” Antonio nodded and scooted gracefully back towards a wall to use as a support before even attempting to stand. Although, as soon as he was up the feeling of discomfort vanished, as quickly and oddly as it had started; leaving him with nothing but warmth filling his every cell and fiber. As the two of them began to exit the cave, Antonio took one last glance around the place, and the comforting glow of the symbols. Though, they looked different somehow. Familiar, like he could actually read them.

As the two of them stepped out of the cave he thought he saw one line reading: “To lord over all that swims, walks, and flies; let his true stature be revealed.”

The cheetah shuddered as he started the long hike back. He was unsure what had happened, but one thing was certain. They needed to get back to Alan to see if he had found out more. And more than that whether he had...

1223322221121.content:
Antonio followed Blake as the wolf made his way down the broken rock contours of the old, fern-and-vine-shrouded trail. The dead cone of the volcano loomed behind them like the body of a fallen god, buried in the Earth’s crust. Around them the verdant green of the park was lush and full; the leaves rustled and muffled all surrounding sounds as they went. He couldn’t shake off the feeling of comfort and laziness that had crept into his mind.

Right now, the most he wanted to do was sit down, relax, and maybe jerk off.

And it felt so good!

“C’mon, Anton: keep up,” Blake called back.

The cheetah nodded and redoubled his efforts. He’d been high before but while this wasn’t exactly like those experiences, it was close enough for him to know he should just ride this out as safely as possible. Whatever had been in that black dust seemed to be having a soporific effect.

Blake kept pushing ahead until they were back on clearer paths. The way they’d come had been closer to a game track or animal trail than anything the park service would have built. He wondered how many people knew it was even there in the first place. He brought himself and his cheetah companion to the main trail and, finally free of the closeness of the foliage, broke into a run.

He didn’t even hear Antonio calling after him as he jogged away.

He raised his sensitive muzzle to the wind and caught Alan’s scent. He wasn’t far off or had at least passed this way recently. He half-closed his eyes and let the exhilaration of his running fill him like it had his primitive ancestors. The wolves of old had been runners: pack hunters. To track his newly-found boyfriend by scent stirred him in ways he’d not expected. They were thrillingly primal.

He rounded a bend where the trail branched off into a small picnic ground. Leaping over a hillock of ferns and wild geraniums, he came to a stop and stared.

It was Alan.

Slowly, he tilted his head back as the bunny turned around at his approach.

His eyes rose from Alan’s knees up past the rabbit’s ample groin, over his toned stomach, past his chest, to his blushing face. The giant man’s long ears twitched as a breeze flowed by. Blake felt his mouth hanging open but didn’t close it. He clutched the assorted old scrolls, stones, and carved idols in his arms, protectively. A small, feral part of himself felt an instant of fear at being in the presence of something four times his size.

Barely coming up to Alan’s thigh, he gulped air while trying to think of something to say.

“Hi, Blake,” the rabbit said, shyly. “Uh, I don’t think I’m going to fit in your house.”
